Description: Small marl pottery double-vase, comprising two conjoined ovoid vessels each with a flat base, convex body with one pierced tubular handle at the shoulder and everted ledge-rim. Both vases are decorated on both sides of the body with a large red-painted spiral; wavy-lines are painted above and on the handles and a single wavy line runs from the handles to the base.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D33a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). From Petrie’s excavations at Hu: see W. M. F. Petrie, Diospolis Parva: the cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. Egypt Exploration Fund Memoir 20. (London 1901).
